name: Bulbasaur
description: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.

name: Ivysaur
description: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

name: Venusaur
description: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

name: Charmander
description: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

name: Charmeleon
description: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

name: Charizard
description: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

name: Squirtle
description: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

name: Wartortle
description: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.

name: Blastoise
description: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

name: Caterpie
description: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

name: Metapod
description: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

name: Butterfree
description: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

name: Weedle
description: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

name: Kakuna
description: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

name: Beedrill
description: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

name: Pidgey
description: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

name: Pidgeotto
description: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

name: Pidgeot
description: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

name: Rattata
description: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

name: Raticate
description: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.

name: Spearow
description: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.

name: Fearow
description: The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.

name: Ekans
description: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.

name: Arbok
description: The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.

name: Pikachu
description: With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.

name: Raichu
description: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

name: Sandshrew
description: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

name: Sandslash
description: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.

name: Nidoran♀
description: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.

name: Nidorina
description: It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.

name: Nidoqueen
description: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

name: Nidoran♂
description: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

name: Nidorino
description: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

name: Nidoking
description: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

name: Clefairy
description: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

name: Clefable
description: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

name: Vulpix
description: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

name: Ninetales
description: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

name: Jigglypuff
description: Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.

name: Wigglytuff
description: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.

name: Zubat
description: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.

name: Golbat
description: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

name: Oddish
description: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

name: Gloom
description: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

name: Vileplume
description: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.

name: Paras
description: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.

name: Parasect
description: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

name: Venonat
description: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.

name: Venomoth
description: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

name: Diglett
description: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.

name: Dugtrio
description: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

name: Meowth
description: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

name: Persian
description: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

name: Psyduck
description: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

name: Golduck
description: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

name: Mankey
description: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

name: Primeape
description: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.

name: Growlithe
description: It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.

name: Arcanine
description: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

name: Poliwag
description: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice when its tail grows back, either.

name: Poliwhirl
description: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.

name: Poliwrath
description: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.

name: Abra
description: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.

name: Kadabra
description: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

name: Alakazam
description: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

name: Machop
description: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Machoke
description: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

name: Machamp
description: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

name: Bellsprout
description: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

name: Weepinbell
description: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.

name: Victreebel
description: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.

name: Tentacool
description: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

name: Tentacruel
description: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.

name: Geodude
description: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.

name: Graveler
description: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

name: Golem
description: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

name: Ponyta
description: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

name: Rapidash
description: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

name: Slowpoke
description: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.

name: Slowbro
description: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.

name: Magnemite
description: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.

name: Magneton
description: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.

name: Farfetch'd
description: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

name: Doduo
description: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.

name: Dodrio
description: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.

name: Seel
description: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.

name: Dewgong
description: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.

name: Grimer
description: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.

name: Muk
description: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.

name: Shellder
description: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

name: Cloyster
description: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.

name: Gastly
description: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.

name: Haunter
description: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

name: Gengar
description: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.

name: Onix
description: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.

name: Drowzee
description: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.

name: Hypno
description: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.

name: Krabby
description: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.

name: Kingler
description: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

name: Voltorb
description: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.

name: Electrode
description: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

name: Exeggcute
description: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

name: Exeggutor
description: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

name: Cubone
description: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.

name: Marowak
description: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon’s body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Hitmonlee
description: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.

name: Hitmonchan
description: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.

name: Lickitung
description: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.

name: Koffing
description: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.

name: Weezing
description: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.

name: Rhyhorn
description: It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.

name: Rhydon
description: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.

name: Chansey
description: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.

name: Tangela
description: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.

name: Kangaskhan
description: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.

name: Horsea
description: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

name: Seadra
description: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.

name: Goldeen
description: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

name: Seaking
description: Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

name: Staryu
description: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

name: Starmie
description: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

name: Mr. Mime
description: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.

name: Scyther
description: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

name: Jynx
description: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

name: Electabuzz
description: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

name: Magmar
description: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

name: Pinsir
description: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.

name: Tauros
description: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.

name: Magikarp
description: This Pokémon is very sensitive to cold. In the warmth of Alola, it appears quite lively.

name: Gyarados
description: It’s said that the patterns on its back are related to the stars in the night sky, but the details of that relationship remain unclear.

name: Lapras
description: Every night, it wanders around in search of prey, whose movements it restrains by spewing threads before it bites into them with its fangs.

name: Ditto
description: Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and sinks its fangs into the nape of its target’s neck.

name: Eevee
description: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.

name: Vaporeon
description: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.

name: Jolteon
description: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.

name: Flareon
description: Igglybuff loves to sing. Its marshmallow-like body gives off a faint sweet smell.

name: Porygon
description: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

name: Omanyte
description: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

name: Omastar
description: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.

name: Kabuto
description: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

name: Kabutops
description: Clothing made from Mareep’s fleece is easily charged with static electricity, so a special process is used on it.

name: Aerodactyl
description: In the places on its body where fleece doesn’t grow, its skin is rubbery and doesn’t conduct electricity. Those spots are safe to touch.

name: Snorlax
description: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.

name: Articuno
description: This Pokémon uses its round tail as a float. The ball of Marill’s tail is filled with nutrients that have been turned into an oil.

name: Zapdos
description: It spends most of its time in the water. On sunny days, Azumarill floats on the surface of the water and sunbathes.

name: Moltres
description: If a tree branch shakes when there is no wind, it’s a Sudowoodo, not a tree. It hides from the rain.

name: Dratini
description: At nightfall, these Pokémon appear on the shores of lakes. They announce their territorial claims by letting out cries that sound like shouting.

name: Dragonair
description: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.

name: Dragonite
description: Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.

name: Mewtwo
description: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.

name: Mew
description: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.

name: Chikorita
description: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.

name: Bayleef
description: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

name: Meganium
description: It has an easygoing nature. It doesn’t care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.

name: Cyndaquil
description: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe’s next move.

name: Quilava
description: When this Pokémon becomes angry, its pores secrete a poisonous sweat, which it sprays at its opponent’s eyes.

name: Typhlosion
description: It has a weakness for shiny things. It’s been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.

name: Totodile
description: Miraculously, this former Slowpoke’s latent intelligence was drawn out when Shellder poison raced through its brain.

name: Croconaw
description: What gives meaning to its life is surprising others. If you set your ear against the red orbs around its neck, you can hear shrieking.

name: Feraligatr
description: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

name: Sentret
description: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to pump up its counterstrike.

name: Furret
description: Girafarig’s rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this Pokémon from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.

name: Hoothoot
description: Motionless, it hangs from trees, waiting for its bug Pokémon prey to come to it. Its favorite in Alola is Cutiefly.

name: Noctowl
description: When something approaches it, it fires off fragments of its steel shell in attack. This is not a conscious action but a conditioned reflex.

name: Ledyba
description: This Pokémon’s tiny wings have some scientists saying that Dunsparce used to fly through the sky in ancient times.

name: Ledian
description: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

name: Spinarak
description: It is said that if an Onix lives for over 100 years, its composition changes to become diamond-like.

name: Ariados
description: It grows close to others easily and is also easily spoiled. The disparity between its face and its actions makes many young people wild about it.

name: Crobat
description: While it has powerful jaws, it doesn’t care for disputes, so it rarely has a chance to display their might.

name: Chinchou
description: When faced with a larger opponent, it swallows as much water as it can to match the opponent’s size.

name: Lanturn
description: Bulky pincers account for one third of Scizor’s body weight. A single swing of one of these pincers will crush a boulder completely.

name: Pichu
description: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

name: Cleffa
description: Heracross loves sweet sap and will go looking through forests for it. The Pokémon uses its two antennae to pick up scents as it searches.

name: Igglybuff
description: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.

name: Togepi
description: This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.

name: Togetic
description: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.

name: Natu
description: Molten magma courses throughout Slugma’s circulatory system. If this Pokémon is chilled, the magma cools and hardens. Its body turns brittle and chunks fall off, reducing its size.

name: Xatu
description: Magcargo’s shell is actually its skin that hardened as a result of cooling. Its shell is very brittle and fragile—just touching it causes it to crumble apart. This Pokémon returns to its original size by dipping itself in magma.

name: Mareep
description: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

name: Flaaffy
description: If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.

name: Ampharos
description: It will regrow any branches that break off its head. People keep particularly beautiful Corsola branches as charms to promote safe childbirth.

name: Bellossom
description: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.

name: Marill
description: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.

name: Azumarill
description: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.

name: Sudowoodo
description: The pointed feathers of these Pokémon are sharper than swords. Skarmory and Corviknight fight viciously over territory.

name: Politoed
description: It cooperates with others skillfully. When it becomes your partner, it’s very loyal to you as its Trainer and will obey your orders.

name: Hoppip
description: They spew flames mixed with poison to finish off their opponents. They divvy up their prey evenly among the members of their pack.

name: Skiploom
description: With the arrival of a storm at sea, this Pokémon will show itself on the surface. When a Kingdra and a Dragonite meet, a fierce battle ensues.

name: Jumpluff
description: For its nest, Phanpy digs a vertical pit in the ground at the edge of a river. It marks the area around its nest with its trunk to let the others know that the area has been claimed.

name: Aipom
description: Donphan’s favorite attack is curling its body into a ball, then charging at its foe while rolling at high speed. Once it starts rolling, this Pokémon can’t stop very easily.

name: Sunkern
description: This is a Porygon that was updated with special data. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about many different subjects all on its own.

name: Sunflora
description: Stantler’s magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.

name: Yanma
description: The fluid of Smeargle’s tail secretions changes in the intensity of its hue as the Pokémon’s emotions change.

name: Wooper
description: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.

name: Quagsire
description: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

name: Espeon
description: If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will bathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty, Smoochum doesn’t really seem to care.

name: Umbreon
description: When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder, it gets full-on rowdy.

name: Murkrow
description: This Pokémon is still small and timid. Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised, flames leak from its mouth and its nose.

name: Slowking
description: Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it’s been supporting the lives of people and other Pokémon since ancient times.

name: Misdreavus
description: Whenever a Blissey finds a weakened Pokémon, it will share its egg and offer its care until the other Pokémon is all better.

name: Unown
description: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

name: Wobbuffet
description: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

name: Girafarig
description: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

name: Pineco
description: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

name: Forretress
description: Even sealed in its shell, it can move freely. Hard and fast, it has outstanding destructive power.

name: Dunsparce
description: Its body can’t be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.

name: Gligar
description: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

name: Steelix
description: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

name: Snubbull
description: Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pokémon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.

name: Granbull
description: The leaves growing out of Grovyle’s body are convenient for camouflaging it from enemies in the forest. This Pokémon is a master at climbing trees in jungles.

name: Qwilfish
description: The leaves growing on Sceptile’s body are very sharp edged. This Pokémon is very agile—it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.

name: Scizor
description: Torchic sticks with its Trainer, following behind with unsteady steps. This Pokémon breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit, including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.

name: Shuckle
description: In battle, Blaziken blows out intense flames from its wrists and attacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more intensely this Pokémon’s wrists burn.

name: Heracross
description: The fin on Mudkip’s head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this Pokémon can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.

name: Sneasel
description: Swampert is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This Pokémon also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.

name: Teddiursa
description: At first sight, Poochyena takes a bite at anything that moves. This Pokémon chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.

name: Ursaring
description: Mightyena gives obvious signals when it is preparing to attack. It starts to growl deeply and then flattens its body. This Pokémon will bite savagely with its sharply pointed fangs.

name: Slugma
description: It marks its territory by rubbing its bristly fur on trees. This variety of Zigzagoon is friendlier and calmer than the kind native to Galar.

name: Magcargo
description: Its fur is strong and supple. Shaving brushes made with shed Linoone hairs are highly prized.

name: Swinub
description: Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pokémon’s feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.

name: Piloswine
description: Silcoon tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from falling. There, this Pokémon hangs quietly while it awaits evolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.

name: Corsola
description: Beautifly’s favorite food is the sweet pollen of flowers. If you want to see this Pokémon, just leave a potted flower by an open window. Beautifly is sure to come looking for pollen.

name: Remoraid
description: Dustox is instinctively drawn to light. Swarms of this Pokémon are attracted by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak havoc by stripping the leaves off roadside trees for food.

name: Octillery
description: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.

name: Delibird
description: It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall. It feeds on aquatic mosses that grow in the riverbed.

name: Mantine
description: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo’s cells, making it more powerful.

name: Skarmory
description: If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut. It delights in surprising foraging Pokémon.

name: Houndour
description: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.

name: Houndoom
description: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe’s mind and take preemptive action.

name: Kingdra
description: Swellow flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This Pokémon dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by Swellow’s clawed feet, preventing escape.

name: Phanpy
description: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.

name: Donphan
description: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.

name: Porygon2
description: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

name: Stantler
description: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

name: Smeargle
description: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.

name: Tyrogue
description: If it’s in a pinch, it will secrete a sweet liquid from the tip of its head. Syrup made from gathering that liquid is tasty on bread.

name: Hitmontop
description: Masquerain intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns of its eyespots. If that doesn’t work, it deftly makes its escape on its set of four wings.

name: Smoochum
description: Shroomish live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This Pokémon feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.

name: Elekid
description: Breloom closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork, then throws punches with its stretchy arms. This Pokémon’s fighting technique puts boxers to shame.

name: Magby
description: Slakoth lolls around for over 20 hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This Pokémon’s sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.

name: Miltank
description: Vigoroth is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can’t tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This Pokémon’s stress level rises if it can’t be moving constantly.

name: Blissey
description: Slaking spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this Pokémon reluctantly moves to another spot.

name: Raikou
description: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.

name: Entei
description: Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.

name: Suicune
description: A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.

name: Larvitar
description: The cry of a Whismur is over 100 decibels. If you’re close to a Whismur when it lets out a cry, you’ll be stuck with an all-day headache.

name: Pupitar
description: Loudred’s ears serve as speakers, and they can put out sound waves powerful enough to blow away a house.

name: Tyranitar
description: In the past, people would use the loud voices of these Pokémon as a means of communication between distant cities.

name: Lugia
description: Although they enjoy comparing their strength, they’re also kind. They value etiquette, praising opponents they battle.

name: Ho-oh
description: The ball on Azurill’s tail bounces like a rubber ball, and it’s full of the nutrients the Pokémon needs to grow.

name: Celebi
description: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it’s in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.

name: Treecko
description: Skitty has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This Pokémon is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.

name: Grovyle
description: Delcatty prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this Pokémon eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.

name: Sceptile
description: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it’s believed that Sableye will steal people’s spirits away.

name: Torchic
description: It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks— to build up the steel armor that protects its body.

name: Combusken
description: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.

name: Blaziken
description: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.

name: Mudkip
description: It is said that through meditation, Medicham heightens energy inside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This Pokémon hides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.

name: Marshtomp
description: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

name: Swampert
description: It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so it can move quickly. It eases its soreness with electricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.

name: Poochyena
description: Minun is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.

name: Mightyena
description: With the arrival of night, Volbeat emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This Pokémon is attracted by the sweet aroma of Illumise.

name: Zigzagoon
description: Illumise attracts a swarm of Volbeat using a sweet fragrance. Once the Volbeat have gathered, this Pokémon leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of the night sky.

name: Linoone
description: Virtually all of Gulpin’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This Pokémon’s stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.

name: Wurmple
description: It won’t attack while it’s alone—not even if it spots prey. Instead, it waits for other Carvanha to join it, and then the Pokémon attack as a group.

name: Silcoon
description: As soon as it catches the scent of prey, Sharpedo will jet seawater from its backside, hurtling toward the target to attack at 75 mph.

name: Beautifly
description: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

name: Cascoon
description: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.

name: Dustox
description: Numel is extremely dull witted—it doesn’t notice being hit. However, it can’t stand hunger for even a second. This Pokémon’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.

name: Lotad
description: Camerupt has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this Pokémon’s back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.

name: Lombre
description: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.

name: Ludicolo
description: Spoink bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this Pokémon cannot afford to stop bouncing—if it stops, its heart will stop.

name: Seedot
description: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this Pokémon uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.

name: Nuzleaf
description: Its steps are shaky and stumbling. Walking for a long time makes it feel sick.

name: Shiftry
description: Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert. Once something has fallen in, there is no escape.

name: Taillow
description: The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two wings together cause severe headaches.

name: Swellow
description: This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.

name: Wingull
description: Cacnea lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this Pokémon shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.

name: Pelipper
description: During the daytime, Cacturne remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This Pokémon becomes active at night when the temperature drops.

name: Ralts
description: Its cottony wings are full of air, making them light and fluffy to the touch. Swablu takes diligent care of its wings.

name: Kirlia
description: As it flies in a calm and relaxed manner, Altaria performs a humming song that would enrapture any audience.

name: Gardevoir
description: Memories of battling its archrival Seviper are etched into every cell of Zangoose’s body. This Pokémon adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.

name: Surskit
description: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It’s active on the night of a full moon.

name: Masquerain
description: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.

name: Shroomish
description: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.

name: Breloom
description: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

name: Slakoth
description: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.

name: Vigoroth
description: A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.

name: Slaking
description: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.

name: Nincada
description: This mysterious Pokémon started life as an ancient clay figurine made over 20,000 years ago.

name: Ninjask
description: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Lileep once lived in warm seas that existed approximately 100,000,000 years ago.

name: Shedinja
description: It has short legs and can’t walk very fast, but its neck and tentacles can extend to over three times their usual length to nab distant prey.

name: Whismur
description: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Anorith lived in the ocean about 100,000,000 years ago, hunting with its pair of claws.

name: Loudred
description: After evolution, this Pokémon emerged onto land. Its lower body has become stronger, and blows from its tail are devastating.

name: Exploud
description: Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokémon’s marvelous vitality has made it a subject of research.

name: Makuhita
description: Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists. It has even been referred to as the most beautiful Pokémon of all.

name: Hariyama
description: Although its form changes with the weather, that is apparently the result of a chemical reaction and not the result of its own free will.

name: Azurill
description: It changes its hue to blend into its surroundings. If no one takes notice of it for too long, it will pout and never reveal itself.

name: Nosepass
description: It eats up emotions like malice, jealousy, and resentment, so some people are grateful for its presence.

name: Skitty
description: It’s a stuffed toy that was thrown away and became possessed, ever searching for the one who threw it away so it can exact its revenge.

name: Delcatty
description: If it finds bad children who won’t listen to their parents, it will spirit them away—or so it’s said.

name: Sableye
description: Its body is entirely hollow. When it opens its mouth, it sucks everything in as if it were a black hole.

name: Mawile
description: Chimecho makes its cries echo inside its hollow body. When this Pokémon becomes enraged, its cries result in ultrasonic waves that have the power to knock foes flying.

name: Aron
description: It tends to move in a pack. Individuals squash against one another to toughen their spirits.

name: Lairon
description: It’s said that if they are seen at midnight, they’ll cause heavy snow. They eat snow and ice to survive.

name: Aggron
description: It has a body of ice that won’t melt, even with fire. It can instantly freeze moisture in the atmosphere.

name: Meditite
description: Sealeo live on top of drift ice. They go swimming when they’re on the hunt, seeking out their prey by scent.

name: Medicham
description: Walrein form herds of 20 to 30 individuals. When a threat appears, the herd’s leader will protect the group with its life.

name: Electrike
description: It’s not the strongest swimmer. It wags its tail to lure in its prey and then gulps them down as soon as they get close.

name: Manectric
description: The color of its body changes with the water temperature. The coloration of Gorebyss in Alola is almost blindingly vivid.

name: Plusle
description: There was an era when it was overfished due to the rumor that having one of its heart-shaped scales would enable you to find a sweetheart.

name: Minun
description: Bagon jumps off cliffs every day, trying to grow stronger so that someday it will be able to fly.

name: Volbeat
description: This Pokémon has covered its body in a hard shell that has the same composition as bone. Shelgon stores energy for evolution.

name: Illumise
description: Salamence is an unusual Pokémon in that it was able to evolve a body with wings just by constantly wishing to be able to fly.

name: Roselia
description: From its rear, Beldum emits a magnetic force that rapidly pulls opponents in. They get skewered on Beldum’s sharp claws.

name: Gulpin
description: Two Beldum have become stuck together via their own magnetic forces. With two brains, the resulting Metang has doubled psychic powers.

name: Swalot
description: Because the magnetic powers of these Pokémon get stronger in freezing temperatures, Metagross living on snowy mountains are full of energy.

name: Carvanha
description: Every bit of Regirock’s body is made of stone. As parts of its body erode, this Pokémon sticks rocks to itself to repair what’s been lost.

name: Sharpedo
description: With cold air that can reach temperatures as low as −328 degrees Fahrenheit, Regice instantly freezes any creature that approaches it.

name: Wailmer
description: Latias is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this Pokémon ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.

name: Wailord
description: Latios has the ability to make others see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This Pokémon is intelligent and understands human speech.

name: Numel
description: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.

name: Camerupt
description: Groudon is said to be the personification of the land itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Kyogre, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

name: Torkoal
description: A legend states that Jirachi will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this Pokémon senses danger, it will fight without awakening.

name: Spoink
description: The DNA of a space virus underwent a sudden mutation upon exposure to a laser beam and resulted in Deoxys. The crystalline organ on this Pokémon’s chest appears to be its brain.

name: Grumpig
description: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.

name: Spinda
description: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.

name: Trapinch
description: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic Torterra dwelled.

name: Vibrava
description: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can’t extinguish the fire.

name: Flygon
description: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.

name: Cacnea
description: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.

name: Cacturne
description: It doesn’t like to be taken care of. It’s difficult to bond with since it won’t listen to its Trainer.

name: Swablu
description: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

name: Altaria
description: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.

name: Zangoose
description: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.

name: Seviper
description: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.

name: Lunatone
description: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

name: Solrock
description: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.

name: Barboach
description: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.

name: Whiscash
description: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

name: Corphish
description: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.

name: Crawdaunt
description: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokémon can receive some of the other Luxio’s electricity and power up its own electric blasts.

name: Baltoy
description: Luxray can see through solid objects. It will instantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls, even if the walls are thick.

name: Claydol
description: The pollen it releases contains poison. If this Pokémon is raised on clean water, the poison’s toxicity is increased.

name: Lileep
description: After captivating opponents with its sweet scent, it lashes them with its thorny whips.

name: Cradily
description: A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.

name: Anorith
description: In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of this Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder than steel, to make helmets.

name: Armaldo
description: A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on its face was plenty tough.

name: Feebas
description: The bones of its face are huge and hard, so they were mistaken for its spine until after this Pokémon was successfully restored.

name: Milotic
description: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

name: Castform
description: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.

name: Kecleon
description: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

name: Shuppet
description: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

name: Banette
description: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

name: Duskull
description: As a bud, it barely moves. It sits still, placidly waiting for sunlight to appear.

name: Dusclops
description: This Pokémon’s habitat shapes its physique. According to some theories, life in warm ocean waters causes this variation to develop.

name: Tropius
description: Its search for food sometimes leads it onto land, where it leaves behind a sticky trail of slime as it passes through.

name: Chimecho
description: In their search for comfortable trees, they get into territorial disputes with groups of Passimian. They win about half the time.

name: Absol
description: Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children. However, it often quickly runs away again when the children play too roughly with it.

name: Wynaut
description: If both of Buneary’s ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It’s a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.

name: Snorunt
description: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds with superdestructive kicks.

name: Glalie
description: Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads, this Pokémon will also, on a whim, cast spells that help people.

name: Spheal
description: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

name: Sealeo
description: It would claim another Pokémon’s nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.

name: Walrein
description: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.

name: Clamperl
description: From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at opponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit them from over 16 feet away.

name: Huntail
description: In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots from its tail during battle. As this Pokémon’s diet varies, so does the stench of its fluid.

name: Gorebyss
description: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesn’t come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.

name: Relicanth
description: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.

name: Luvdisc
description: It expels both sweat and tears from its eyes. The sweat is a little salty, while the tears have a slight bitterness.

name: Bagon
description: It mimics everyone it sees, but it puts extra effort into copying the graceful dance steps of Mr. Rime as practice.

name: Shelgon
description: Mimicking Chansey, Happiny will place an egg- shaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will treasure this stone.

name: Salamence
description: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it’s one of them. This way they won’t attack it.

name: Beldum
description: Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way, Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.

name: Metang
description: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from a protrusion on either side of its head to probe pitch-dark caves.

name: Metagross
description: Garchomp makes its home in volcanic mountains. It flies through the sky as fast as a jet airplane, hunting down as much prey as it can.

name: Regirock
description: It’s exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.

name: Regice
description: It controls waves known as auras, which are powerful enough to pulverize huge rocks. It uses these waves to take down its prey.

name: Registeel
description: It moves through the sands with its mouth open, swallowing sand along with its prey. It gets rid of the sand by spouting it from its nose.

name: Latias
description: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.

name: Latios
description: Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokémon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.

name: Kyogre
description: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.

name: Groudon
description: When night falls, their pink patterns begin to shine. They’re popular with divers, so there are resorts that feed them to keep them close.

name: Rayquaza
description: Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this region may be the cause.

name: Jirachi
description: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.

name: Deoxys
description: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.

name: Turtwig
description: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.

name: Grotle
description: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.

name: Torterra
description: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Chimchar
description: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.

name: Monferno
description: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.

name: Infernape
description: Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts from this Pokémon’s leaves. There’s a popular perfume made using that scent.

name: Piplup
description: Any who become captivated by the beauty of the snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen before they know it.

name: Prinplup
description: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

name: Empoleon
description: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.

name: Starly
description: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.

name: Staravia
description: True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses the blades on its elbows only in defense of something or someone.

name: Staraptor
description: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don’t come back.

name: Bidoof
description: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.

name: Bibarel
description: After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain, her regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokémon was born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.

name: Kricketot
description: One boy’s invention led to the development of many different machines that take advantage of Rotom’s unique capabilities.

name: Kricketune
description: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

name: Shinx
description: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

name: Luxio
description: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

name: Luxray
description: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.

name: Budew
description: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.

name: Roserade
description: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

name: Cranidos
description: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.

name: Rampardos
description: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

name: Shieldon
description: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

name: Bastiodon
description: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

name: Burmy
description: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

name: Wormadam
description: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.

name: Mothim
description: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

name: Combee
description: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.

name: Vespiquen
description: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.

name: Pachirisu
description: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.

name: Buizel
description: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

name: Floatzel
description: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.

name: Cherubi
description: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

name: Cherrim
description: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle—it can be used to break open hard berries as well.

name: Shellos
description: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.

name: Gastrodon
description: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.

name: Ambipom
description: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

name: Drifloon
description: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

name: Drifblim
description: This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious. It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect information about its surroundings.

name: Buneary
description: Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon. So much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was the first Pokémon to partner with people.

name: Lopunny
description: These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans. Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up to people in about three days.

name: Mismagius
description: Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

name: Honchkrow
description: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

name: Glameow
description: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

name: Purugly
description: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

name: Chingling
description: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

name: Stunky
description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.

name: Skuntank
description: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

name: Bronzor
description: Late at night, it appears beside people’s pillows. As it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body give off a faint glow.

name: Bronzong
description: When dark mists emanate from its body, don’t get too near. If you do, your nightmares will become reality.

name: Bonsly
description: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you’re scattering food for them, be careful—several hundred of them can gather at once.

name: Mime Jr.
description: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.

name: Happiny
description: Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.

name: Chatot
description: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

name: Spiritomb
description: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

name: Gible
description: It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in water will cause it to soften a bit.

name: Gabite
description: If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.

name: Garchomp
description: This hardy Pokémon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah.

name: Munchlax
description: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won’t be able to fly for a little while.

name: Riolu
description: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.

name: Lucario
description: It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill’s rampant digging.

name: Hippopotas
description: It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.

name: Hippowdon
description: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.

name: Skorupi
description: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.

name: Drapion
description: Graceful ripples running across the water’s surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.

name: Croagunk
description: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.

name: Toxicroak
description: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.

name: Carnivine
description: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.

name: Finneon
description: If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to quietly pass by.

name: Lumineon
description: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

name: Mantyke
description: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

name: Snover
description: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

name: Abomasnow
description: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.

name: Weavile
description: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.

name: Magnezone
description: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.

name: Lickilicky
description: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.

name: Rhyperior
description: Petilil appears around sources of clean water. Boiling leaves from this Pokémon’s head results in a liquid that’s sometimes used as a bug repellent.

name: Tangrowth
description: It’s believed that even first-rate gardeners have a hard time getting the flower on a Lilligant’s head to bloom.

name: Electivire
description: Anglers love the fight this Pokémon puts up on the hook. And there are always more to catch— many people release them into lakes illicitly.

name: Magmortar
description: The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun sets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand and sleeps until sunrise.

name: Togekiss
description: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.

name: Yanmega
description: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.

name: Leafeon
description: It derives its power from fire burning inside its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will immediately fall asleep.

name: Glaceon
description: The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokémon can deliver punches capable of obliterating a dump truck.

name: Gliscor
description: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.

name: Mamoswine
description: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.

name: Porygon-Z
description: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.

name: Gallade
description: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.

name: Probopass
description: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.

name: Dusknoir
description: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.

name: Froslass
description: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.

name: Rotom
description: This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.

name: Uxie
description: Zorua is a timid Pokémon. This disposition seems to be what led to the development of Zorua’s ability to take on the forms of other creatures.

name: Mesprit
description: This Pokémon cares deeply about others of its kind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to keep its den and pack safe.

name: Azelf
description: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

name: Dialga
description: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

name: Palkia
description: Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.

name: Heatran
description: It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky, this Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children. Some call it the Witch of Punishment.

name: Regigigas
description: It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes conflict. It’s also able to predict the future based on the movement of the stars.

name: Giratina
description: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.

name: Cresselia
description: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.

name: Phione
description: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

name: Manaphy
description: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

name: Darkrai
description: Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.

name: Shaymin
description: By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.

name: Arceus
description: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.

name: Victini
description: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.

name: Snivy
description: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.

name: Servine
description: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.

name: Serperior
description: They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. They’re very popular Pokémon in the Galar region.

name: Tepig
description: No one knows what the Poké Ball–like pattern on Foongus means or why Foongus has it.

name: Pignite
description: This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes. If the spores aren’t washed off quickly, they’ll grow into mushrooms wherever they land.

name: Emboar
description: It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the ocean’s surface.

name: Oshawott
description: Most of this Pokémon’s body composition is identical to sea water. It makes sunken ships its lair.

name: Dewott
description: Fishermen take them along on long voyages, because if you have an Alomomola with you, there’ll be no need for a doctor or medicine.

name: Samurott
description: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t produce a charge on its own.

name: Patrat
description: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.

name: Watchog
description: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.

name: Lillipup
description: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.

name: Herdier
description: The two minigears that compose this Pokémon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.

name: Stoutland
description: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon’s rotation speed increases sharply.

name: Purrloin
description: From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.

name: Liepard
description: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

name: Pansage
description: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

name: Simisage
description: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

name: Pansear
description: If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.

name: Simisear
description: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.

name: Panpour
description: The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.

name: Simipour
description: This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it’s feared as an emissary of death.

name: Munna
description: This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.

name: Musharna
description: These Pokémon nest in the ground and use their tusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is also how they test each other’s strength.

name: Pidove
description: After battle, this Pokémon carefully sharpens its tusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its tusks—if one breaks, it will never grow back.

name: Tranquill
description: Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up dirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its tusks in top condition.

name: Unfezant
description: When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot becomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot on anyone it doesn’t like.

name: Blitzle
description: It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey. From its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that are harder than steel.

name: Zebstrika
description: With its icy chains, Cryogonal freezes those it encounters. It then takes its victims away to somewhere unknown.

name: Roggenrola
description: When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.

name: Boldore
description: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.
